SEARCH
Package com.dua3.utility.fx.controls

Class InputValidatorFactory

java.lang.Object
com.dua3.utility.fx.controls.InputValidatorFactory
public class InputValidatorFactory extends Object
A factory class for creating input validation functions. The factory provides mechanisms to validate input strings based on different criteria, such as non-empty checks and regular expression matching.

The factory uses a MessageFormatter for formatting error messages when validation fails. The MessageFormatter.format(String, Object...) method is passed the format fmt, the current value, and the arguments passed as args.

    • InputValidatorFactory

      public InputValidatorFactory(MessageFormatter formatter)
      Constructs an instance of InputValidatorFactory. The factory utilizes the provided MessageFormatter to format error messages for input validation.
      Parameters:
      formatter - the MessageFormatter used for formatting error messages when validation fails

    • noCheck

      public <T extends @Nullable Object> Function<T,Optional<String>> noCheck()
      Creates a validation function that accepts any input as valid.
      Type Parameters:
      T - the type of the input to the function, which can optionally be null
      Returns:
      a validation function that accepts any input as valid and always returns an empty Optional

    • nonNull

      public <T extends @Nullable Object> Function<T,Optional<String>> nonNull(String fmt, Object... args)
      Creates a validation function that checks if an input value is non-null. If the input is null, the provided error message format and arguments are used to create an error message.
      Type Parameters:
      T - the type of the input value being validated, which may be nullable
      Parameters:
      fmt - the format string for the error message if validation fails
      args - optional arguments for formatting the error message
      Returns:
      a function that takes an input value and returns an Optional<String> containing a validation error message if the input is null, or an empty Optional otherwise

    • nonEmpty

      public Function<@Nullable String,Optional<String>> nonEmpty(String fmt, Object... args)
      Creates a validation function that checks if a string is non-empty. If the string is empty, the provided error message format and arguments are used to create an error message.
      Parameters:
      fmt - the format string for the error message if validation fails
      args - optional arguments for formatting the error message
      Returns:
      a function that takes a string and returns an Optional<String> containing the error message if the string is null or empty, or an empty Optional if it is valid

      public Function<@Nullable String,Optional<String>> nonBlank(String fmt, Object... args)

      Parameters:
      fmt - the format string for the error message if validation fails
      args - optional arguments for formatting the error message
      Returns:
      a function that takes a string and returns an Optional<String> containing the error message if the string is null or blank, or an empty Optional if it is valid

    • regexp

      public Function<@Nullable String,Optional<String>> regexp(String pattern, String fmt, Object... args)
      Creates a validation function that checks if an input string matches a given regular expression pattern. If the input matches the pattern, the function returns Optional.empty(). Otherwise, it returns an Optional containing a formatted error message.
      Parameters:
      pattern - the regular expression pattern to match against the input string
      fmt - the format string for the error message to be returned on validation failure
      args - optional arguments to include in the formatted error message
      Returns:
      a function that takes a string as input and returns an Optional<String> containing a validation error message if the input is null or does not match the regular expression; otherwise Optional.empty() is returned

    • lengthBetween

      public Function<@Nullable String,Optional<String>> lengthBetween(int min, int max, String fmt, Object... args)
      Creates a function that validates if a given string's length falls within the specified range.
      Parameters:
      min - the minimum allowable length of the string (inclusive)
      max - the maximum allowable length of the string (inclusive)
      fmt - the error message format to use when validation fails
      args - optional arguments to be used in the format string
      Returns:
      a function that takes a string and returns an Optional containing the string if valid, or empty if invalid

    • between

      public <T extends @Nullable Comparable<T>> Function<T,Optional<String>> between(@NonNull T min, @NonNull T max, String fmt, Object... args)
      Creates a function that checks if a given value is within a specified range (inclusive) and returns an optional validation message if the value is not within the range.
      Type Parameters:
      T - the type of the value to be validated, which must be nullable and comparable
      Parameters:
      min - the minimum value for the range, inclusive, must not be null
      max - the maximum value for the range, inclusive, must not be null
      fmt - the format string used for the validation message
      args - optional arguments for the format string
      Returns:
      a function that takes a value of type T and returns an Optional containing a validation message if the value is not within the range, or an empty Optional if it is

    • min

      public <T extends @Nullable Comparable<T>> Function<T,Optional<String>> min(@NonNull T min, String fmt, Object... args)
      Returns a function that validates if the input value is greater than or equal to the specified minimum value.
      Type Parameters:
      T - the type of the value to be validated, which must be nullable and comparable
      Parameters:
      min - the minimum value to compare against, must be non-null
      fmt - the format string for the error message
      args - the arguments referenced by the format string
      Returns:
      a function that takes an input value of type T and returns an Optional containing an error message if the validation fails, or an empty Optional if it succeeds

    • max

      public <T extends @Nullable Comparable<T>> Function<T,Optional<String>> max(@NonNull T max, String fmt, Object... args)
      Returns a Function that applies a validation to the given input and ensures it is less than or equal to the specified maximum value.
      Type Parameters:
      T - the type of the value to be validated, which must be nullable and comparable
      Parameters:
      max - the maximum allowable value of the input; must implement the Comparable interface
      fmt - the format string used for error messages if validation fails
      args - additional arguments for formatting the error message
      Returns:
      a Function that takes an input, validates it against the maximum value condition, and wraps the result in an Optional

    • positive

      public <N extends @Nullable Number> Function<N,Optional<String>> positive(String fmt, Object... args)
      Returns a function that evaluates whether a given number is positive. The function checks if the input number is not null and greater than zero. If the condition is satisfied, it applies the validation logic defined within.
      Type Parameters:
      N - the generic Number type
      Parameters:
      fmt - the format string used for message creation when validation fails
      args - additional arguments required for formatting the message
      Returns:
      a function that checks if a given number is positive and returns an Optional containing a message if validation fails or empty if successful

    • negative

      public <N extends @Nullable Number> Function<N,Optional<String>> negative(String fmt, Object... args)
      Returns a function that checks if a given number is negative and formats the result.
      Type Parameters:
      N - The type of the number to be validated, which can be nullable.
      Parameters:
      fmt - The format string to use for any messages generated.
      args - Optional arguments to be used with the format string.
      Returns:
      A function that takes a number and returns an Optional containing a formatted message if the number is negative, or an empty Optional if it is not.

    • nonPositive

      public <N extends @Nullable Number> Function<N,Optional<String>> nonPositive(String fmt, Object... args)
      Creates a function to validate if a given number is non-positive (less than or equal to 0).
      Type Parameters:
      N - The type of the number to be validated, which can be nullable.
      Parameters:
      fmt - The format string used for error messages in case the validation fails.
      args - Optional arguments to populate the format string for error messages.
      Returns:
      A function that takes a number and returns an Optional containing an error message if the number is not non-positive, or an empty Optional otherwise.

    • nonNegative

      public <N extends @Nullable Number> Function<N,Optional<String>> nonNegative(String fmt, Object... args)
      Returns a function that takes a nullable Number and checks whether it is non-negative. If the condition is met, an Optional containing a formatted string is returned.
      Type Parameters:
      N - The type of the number to be validated, which can be nullable.
      Parameters:
      fmt - the format string to be used for the message
      args - the arguments referenced by the format specifiers in the format string
      Returns:
      a function that takes a nullable Number and returns an Optional containing the formatted message if the number is valid

    • exists

      public Function<@Nullable Path,Optional<String>> exists(String fmt, Object... args)
      Creates a validation function that checks if a file or directory exists at the specified Path. If the Path does not exist, the provided error message format and arguments are used to create an error message.
      Parameters:
      fmt - the format string for the error message if validation fails
      args - optional arguments for formatting the error message
      Returns:
      a function that takes a Path and returns an Optional<String> containing the error message if the Path is null or does not exist, or an empty Optional if it exists

    • regularFile

      public Function<@Nullable Path,Optional<String>> regularFile(String fmt, Object... args)
      Creates a validation function that checks if the input Path represents a regular file in the file system. If the Path does not refer to a regular file, the provided error message format and arguments are used to create an error message.
      Parameters:
      fmt - the format string for the error message to be returned on validation failure
      args - optional arguments to include in the formatted error message
      Returns:
      a function that takes a Path and returns an Optional<String> containing a validation error message if the Path is null, does not exist, or is not a regular file, or an empty Optional if it is valid

    • regularFileWithExtension

      public Function<@Nullable Path,Optional<String>> regularFileWithExtension(Collection<String> extensions, String fmt, Object... args)
      Creates a validation function that checks if the input Path represents a regular file with an extension included in the specified collection of extensions. If the Path does not meet these conditions, the provided error message format and arguments are used to create an error message.

      Note: provide the file extensions without a leading dot, i.e., to allow text and markdown files, use List.of("txt", "md5").

      Parameters:
      extensions - the collection of allowed file extensions to validate against
      fmt - the format string for the error message to be returned on validation failure
      args - optional arguments to include in the formatted error message
      Returns:
      a function that takes a Path and returns an Optional<String> containing a validation error message if the Path is null, does not exist, is not a regular file, or does not have a valid extension, or an empty Optional if it is valid

    • directory

      public Function<@Nullable Path,Optional<String>> directory(String fmt, Object... args)
      Creates a validation function that checks if the input Path represents a directory in the file system. If the Path is not a directory, the provided error message format and arguments are used to create an error message.
      Parameters:
      fmt - the format string for the error message to be returned on validation failure
      args - optional arguments to include in the formatted error message
      Returns:
      a function that takes a Path and returns an Optional<String> containing a validation error message if the Path is null, does not exist, or is not a directory, or an empty Optional if it is valid
